questions.question: Choose the correct sentence order:
options: Quickly she ran to the station.
She ran quickly to the station.
She to the station ran quickly.
Ran she quickly to the station.
questions.explanation: Standard SVO order: Subject + Verb + Adverb + Object/Place.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: In the park playing were children.
Children were playing in the park.
Playing children were in the park.
Were in the park playing children.
questions.explanation: Subject + auxiliary + main verb + place: 'Children were playing in the park'.

questions.question: Select the correct word order:
options: A beautiful big old house.
An old big beautiful house.
A big old beautiful house.
Beautiful old a big house.
questions.explanation: Adjective order: opinion + size + age + shape + color + origin + material + noun.

questions.question: Choose the correct question form:
options: Where you are going?
You are going where?
Where are you going?
Are you going where?
questions.explanation: Wh-word + auxiliary + subject + main verb: 'Where are you going?'

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: Very she was tired after the long journey.
She was very tired after the long journey.
Tired very she was after the long journey.
After the long journey she was very tired.
questions.explanation: Subject + verb + adverb + adjective: 'She was very tired'.

questions.question: Select the correct order:
options: He yesterday to the market went.
Yesterday he went to the market.
To the market yesterday he went.
He to the market went yesterday.
questions.explanation: Time adverb can come first or end: 'Yesterday he went to the market' is natural.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: The book interesting I found.
I found the book interesting.
Interesting the book I found.
Found I the book interesting.
questions.explanation: 'Find + object + adjective' pattern: 'I found the book interesting'.

questions.question: Choose the correct comparative sentence:
options: This car more expensive is than that one.
This car is more expensive than that one.
More expensive this car is than that one.
Than that one this car is more expensive.
questions.explanation: Subject + verb + comparative adjective + 'than': standard order.

questions.question: Select the correct sentence:
options: Slowly walking was he home.
He was walking slowly home.
Home walking slowly was he.
Walking he was slowly home.
questions.explanation: Subject + was + verb-ing + adverb + direction.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: Coffee I prefer tea to.
I prefer coffee to tea.
To tea I prefer coffee.
Prefer I coffee to tea.
questions.explanation: 'Prefer A to B': Subject + verb + object1 + 'to' + object2.

questions.question: Select the correct order for adjectives:
options: Italian wooden old beautiful table.
Beautiful old wooden Italian table.
Old beautiful Italian wooden table.
A beautiful old Italian wooden table.
questions.explanation: Article + opinion + age + origin + material + noun.

questions.question: Choose the correct passive sentence:
options: By the chef was prepared the meal.
The meal was prepared by the chef.
Prepared was the meal by the chef.
The chef by prepared was the meal.
questions.explanation: Subject + was + past participle + 'by' + agent.

questions.question: Choose the correct question:
options: How much does cost this shirt?
How much this shirt does cost?
How much does this shirt cost?
Does how much cost this shirt?
questions.explanation: Wh-word + auxiliary + subject + main verb.

questions.question: Select the correct sentence:
options: Every day she goes gym to.
She goes to the gym every day.
To gym she goes every day.
Every day to the gym she goes.
questions.explanation: Subject + verb + direction + time adverb.

questions.question: Choose the correct conditional sentence:
options: If rains it, we will stay home.
If it rains, we will stay home.
We will stay home if it rains.
Rains if it, home we stay.
questions.explanation: If + subject + verb, main clause.

questions.question: Choose the correct reported speech:
options: 'I am tired,' she said she was.
She said that she was tired.
She was tired she said that.
Tired she said that she was.
questions.explanation: Subject + said + 'that' + new tense: 'She said that she was tired'.

questions.question: Select the correct adverb position:
options: He carefully drove car the.
He drove the car carefully.
Carefully he drove the car.
The car he drove carefully.
questions.explanation: Subject + verb + object + adverb of manner.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: Not only intelligent he is but also kind.
He is not only intelligent but also kind.
Intelligent he is not only but also kind.
Kind and intelligent not only he is.
questions.explanation: 'Not only... but also' with subject + verb first.

questions.question: Choose the correct relative clause:
options: The man who lives next door is friendly.
Who lives next door the man is friendly.
Friendly is the man who lives next door.
Next door lives who the man is friendly.
questions.explanation: Noun + relative pronoun + clause: standard defining relative clause.

questions.question: Select the correct imperative:
options: The door please close.
Please close the door.
Close please the door.
Door the please close.
questions.explanation: Polite imperative: adverb + verb + object.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: Because tired was she, early she left.
She left early because she was tired.
Tired because she was, she left early.
Early she left because tired was she.
questions.explanation: Main clause + 'because' + reason clause.

questions.question: Choose the correct participle clause:
options: Seeing the accident, he stopped.
He seeing the accident stopped.
Stopped he seeing the accident.
The accident seeing, he stopped.
questions.explanation: Participle phrase + main clause: 'Seeing the accident, he stopped'.

questions.question: Select the correct sentence:
options: Hard she works every day.
She works hard every day.
Every day hard she works.
Works she hard every day.
questions.explanation: Subject + verb + adverb + time.

questions.question: Choose the correct indirect question:
options: Do you know where is she?
Do you know where she is?
Where she is do you know?
Know you where do she is?
questions.explanation: Indirect questions keep statement word order: 'where she is'.

questions.question: Choose the correct cleft sentence:
options: It was John who broke the window.
John it was who broke the window.
Broke the window it was John who.
Who broke the window it was John.
questions.explanation: 'It' + was + focus + 'who/that' + clause.

questions.question: Select the correct sentence:
options: Despite raining, we went out.
Despite the rain, we went out.
The rain despite, we went out.
We went out despite raining.
questions.explanation: 'Despite + noun': 'Despite the rain, we went out'.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: Not only did he win, but also he broke the record.
He not only won but also broke the record.
Did he not only win but also broke the record.
Broke he not only the record but also won.
questions.explanation: Inversion after 'not only': 'Not only did he win...'

questions.question: Select the correct adverb clause position:
options: We stayed home because it rained.
Because it rained we stayed home.
Rained it because we stayed home.
Home we stayed because it rained.
questions.explanation: Both positions correct, but comma needed when clause first.
